alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 3:00PM EDT until March 31 at 12:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Johnson and Wilkinson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23 feet, Moderate flooding continues. Portions of the Old Balls Ferry Road leading to the boat ramp becomes flooded with a foot of water or more. The entire dirt parking lot near the boat ramp is under three to five feet of water. Extensive flooding of the woodlands near the river continues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 22.8 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
